intro: Cnidoscolus multilobus subsp. elasticoides, commonly known as the rubberleaf plant, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by green, spiny fruits that contain edible seeds. Its leaves are known for their elastic texture, which gives the plant its common name. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and adaptability to various growing conditions.
